meanings.definition: The act of causing things to happen at the same time or speed.
meanings.sent1: The synchronization of the dancers' movements was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The music and lights were in perfect synchronization during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimming team made a splash at the competition.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was like a synchronization of gears in a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The synchronization of the traffic lights made the commute smoother.

meanings.definition: The coordination of events to operate simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The synchronization of the fireworks display with the music was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The synchronization of the actors' dialogue and movements was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized clowns entertained the children at the circus.
meanings.sent4: The synchronization of the clock ticking and the rain falling was oddly calming.
meanings.sent5: The synchronization of the chef's cooking steps made the dish perfect.

meanings.definition: The process of ensuring that two or more devices or systems work together in time.
meanings.sent1: The synchronization of the traffic signals prevented accidents at the intersection.
meanings.sent2: The synchronization of the computer network allowed for seamless data transfer.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized robots efficiently assembled the cars on the production line.
meanings.sent4: The synchronization of the heart and lungs is vital for human survival.
meanings.sent5: The synchronization of the team members' efforts led to project success.
